raw_text:
Reds sink 10-man Magpies
 
 Titus Bramble's own goal put Liverpool on the comeback trail as injury-hit Newcastle were well beaten at Anfield.
 
 Patrick Kluivert's close-range finish put Newcastle ahead after 31 minutes, but they were pegged back as Bramble headed in Steven Gerrard's corner. Neil Mellor gave Liverpool the lead before half-time from Milan Baros' pass before the Czech added a third after rounding Shay Given on the hour. Newcastle then had Lee Bowyer sent off for two bookable offences. Liverpool brought back Luis Garcia after a hamstring injury, while Newcastle were forced to draft in Kluivert after Craig Bellamy was a late withdrawal with a back injury sustained in the warm-up. And Garcia should have crowned his return with a goal inside the opening minute when he took a pass from Baros but shot wildly over the top from eight yards. Olivier Bernard was only inches away from giving Newcastle the lead after 20 minutes, when he fired just wide from a free-kick 25 yards out. But Souness's side did go ahead 11 minutes later in highly controversial circumstances.
 
 Kluivert looked suspiciously offside when Kieron Dyer set Bowyer free, but the Dutchman was then perfectly placed to score from six yards. The lead lasted three minutes, with Liverpool back on terms as Bramble headed Gerrard's corner into his own net under pressure from Sami Hyypia. And Liverpool were ahead after 37 minutes when Baros slid a perfect pass into Mellor's path for the youngster to slip a slide-rule finish into Given's bottom corner. Garcia's finishing was wayward, and he was wasteful again in first-half injury time, shooting tamely at Given after good work by Xabi Alonso. Any hopes of a Newcastle recovery looked to be snuffed out on the hour when a brilliant turn and pass by Harry Kewell set Baros free and he rounded Given to score. Jermaine Jenas then missed a glorious chance to throw Newcastle a lifeline, shooting over from just eight yards out from Shola Ameobi's cross. Then Bowyer, who had already been booked for a foul on Alonso, was deservedly shown the red card by referee Graham Poll for a wild challenge on Liverpool substitute Florent Sinama-Pongolle.
 
 Dudek, Finnan, Hyypia, Carragher, Riise, Luis Garcia (Nunez 73), Gerrard, Alonso, Kewell (Traore 85), Baros, Mellor (Sinama Pongolle 75).
 
 Subs not used: Hamann, Harrison.
 
 Bramble 35 og, Mellor 38, Baros 61.
 
 Given, Andrew O'Brien, Elliott, Bramble, Bernard, Bowyer, Dyer (Ambrose 80), Jenas, Milner (N'Zogbia 72), Kluivert (Robert 58), Ameobi.
 
 Subs not used: Harper.
 
 Bowyer (77).
 
 Bowyer, Elliott, Bernard.
 
 Kluivert 32.
 
 43,856.
 
 G Poll (Hertfordshire).
llama3.2:1b:
Liverpool's Luis Garcia scored for Liverpool in the 15th minute, giving them a 1-0 lead. Newcastle were then put away in 60 minutes with Patrick Kluivert scoring after rounding Shay Given on the hour. 

Newcastle took an equalizer in 11 minutes when Olivier Bernard fired wide from a free-kick. The score was level again at 2-2 after 40 minutes.

Liverpool regained the lead in 37 minutes, but were then behind again in 66 minutes with Jermaine Jenas missing a chance to score for Newcastle. 

Newcastle were ahead for the second time when a brilliant turn and pass by Harry Kewell led him to score in the 77th minute.
llama3.2:3b: Liverpool beat Newcastle 3-1 at Anfield as Patrick Kluivert scored for Newcastle before Titus Bramble's own goal and Neil Mellor's free-kick gave Liverpool the lead. The visitors were then reduced to 10 men after Lee Bowyer was sent off, but Jermaine Jenas missed a chance to equalize before Milan Baros sealed the win with a solo effort.
gemma2:2b: Liverpool beat Newcastle 3-1 at Anfield.  Titus Bramble scored an own goal and Steven Gerrard also scored a header for Liverpool. Jermaine Jenas missed a chance to level the score for Newcastle. Lee Bowyer was sent off for two bookable offenses.   Luis Garcia came on and had chances but didn't finish his chances.
qwen2.5:0.5b:
Here's the summary:

Liverpool managed to draw 1-0 against Newcastle with a solid performance. The game started with Newcastle being well beaten at Anfield by a goal from Steven Gerrard and another one from Kean Dyer. Liverpool scored three goals in the first half but fell behind as they were pegged back after a close-range finish from Patrick Kluivert. Neil Mellor provided a second goal for Liverpool after the break. Newcastle's injury time goal was given to Lee Bowyer, while Liverpool's penalty against Newcastle was awarded to Luis Garcia. The match ended with Sunderland not being able to score any goals and Newcastle winning by 1-0.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Liverpool defeated Newcastle with a 3-1 comeback victory, led by goals from Steven Gerrard and Luis Garcia. Newcastle lost 10-man after Lee Bowyer was sent off for two bookable offenses. Liverpool's Luis Garcia scored the winner in the 46th minute, while Patrick Kluivert missed a chance to equalize earlier in the match.
qwen2.5:3b: Titus Bramble's own goal gave Liverpool a comeback win over Newcastle, who were reduced to ten men by Lee Bowyer's red card. Patrick Kluivert scored for Newcastle early on, but Steven Gerrard and Milan Baros struck twice to secure the victory. Luis Garcia missed opportunities for Liverpool in his return from injury, while Newcastle struggled with Bellamy's withdrawal due to a back injury. The match ended 3-1, with Newcastle having only Olivier Bernard as a prominent player in their final lineup.

Reds sink 10-man Magpies

Liverpool on the comeback trail as injury-hit Newcastle were well beaten at Anfield after making progress in a match between Bramble and Steven Gerrard.

Louis Kluivert's close-range finish put Newcastle ahead with Lee Bowyer sent off for two bookable offences. Liverpool brought back his return with a goal inside the opening minute before he took a pass from Milan Baros' passing. Newcastle had been forced to draft after Craig Bellamy was a late withdrawal with a hamstring injury sustained in the warm-up.

Louis should crown his return as goals inside the opening minute when he took a pass from Baros but shot wildly over the top from eight yards. But Souness's side did go ahead 11 minutes later in highly controversial circumstances.

Kluivert looked suspiciously offside when Kieron Dyer set Bowyer free. The Dutchman was then perfectly placed to score from six yards. The lead lasted three minutes, with Liverpool back on terms as Bramble headed Gerrard's corner into his own net under pressure from Sami Hyypia.

Liverpool were ahead after 37 minutes when Baros slid a perfect pass into Mellor's path for the youngster to slip a slide-rule finish into Given's bottom corner. Reds sink 10-man Magpies
 
 Titus Bramble's own goal put Liverpool on the comeback trail as injury-hit Newcastle were well beaten at Anfield.
 
 Patrick Kluivert's close-range finish put Newcastle ahead after 31 minutes, but they were pegged back as Bramble headed in Steven Gerrard's corner. Neil Mellor gave Liverpool the lead before half-time from Milan Baros' pass before the Czech added a third after rounding Shay Given on the hour. Newcastle then had Lee Bowyer sent off for two bookable offences. Liverpool brought back Luis Garcia after a hamstring injury, while Newcastle were forced to draft in Kluivert after Craig Bellamy was a late withdrawal with a back injury sustained in the warm-up. And Garcia should have crowned his return with a goal inside the opening minute when he took a pass from Baros but shot wildly over the top from eight yards out from Steve Given's path. Olivier Bernard was only inches away from giving Liverpool the lead after 20 minutes, when he fired just wide from a free-kick 25 yards out from Barry Andrews' path. But the lead lasted three minutes and a half before the Irishman was booked for a foul on Alonso. Any hopes of a Newcastle recovery looked to be snuffed out on the hour when a brilliant turn and pass by Harry Kewell set Baros free and he rounded Given to score. Jermaine Jenas then missed a glorious chance to throw Liverpool a lifeline, shooting over from just eight yards out from Steve Given's path. Jermain Jenkins then wasted a beautiful opportunity to win 11 minutes with his goal in the second half when he was booked for a foul on Alonso.

Patrick Kluivert's close range finish gave Newcastle a lead, but they were rightly pointed back by Steven Gerrard. Neil Mellor brought in the lead for Liverpool after Milan Baros' pass. Liverpool returned Luis Garcia with a shot inside, while Newcastle faced some more issues. Some players were substituted, and there was a lot of action and speculation.

So, summarizing key points: Reds 10 Magpies, Titus Bramble's goal sent them back. Newcastle scored early but Liverpool recovered through Luis Garcia. Substitutions and key plays are important to include. Also, the referee decisions and some injuries need to be noted.
</think>

tinyllama:1.1b: The Liverpool vs Newcastle United match ended in a 3-1 victory for the Reds after Patrick Kluivert's late goal helped them overcome injuries to key players and secure a crucial win. The match featured a brace for Liverpool and goals from Steven Gerard, Luis García, and Liverpool's own goalkeeper, Tony Brahmble. Newcastle's best chance came in the 37th minute when Kluivert looked offside before being fouled by Kierson Dyler on the edge of the box. However, the visitors were not to be denied as Liverpool scored a second goal after conceding, with Liverpool's own goalkeeper, Tony Brahmble, getting his third in the match. The Reds sealed the win thanks to a penalty and a goal from Fernando Torres in injury time, while Newcastle were left on the wrong end of their third defeat of the season. In the wake of the game, Liverpool's defender, Branislav Ivić, apologized for his comments about Newcastle after being substituted by Lee Bowyer during the match.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Based on the given text, this seems to be an English football match between Liverpool and Newcastle United, with a summary of the main events and performances. The key points mentioned are: Reds win 10-man Magpies, Patrick Kluivert scores for Liverpool; Steven Gerrard's goal puts Liverpool in front, but Newcastle equalize; Liverpool win with goals from Luis Garcia, Steven Gerrard, and more from Fabio Grosso; Bramble is sent off, while Liverpool bring on Luis Garcia after a substitution. Additionally, the match includes fouls from Finnan and Dudek, as well as several challenges from Bowyer.
phi:2.7b: Liverpool won 2-0 against Newcastle at Anfield with goals from Luis Garcia and Steven Gerrard. Manchester United were also defeated by Aston Villa 3-2 at Old Trafford with two goals scored by Wayne Rooney. In European football news, Barcelona defeated A.C. Milan 4-1 in Italy for a place in the quarter-finals of the Champions League.
orca-mini:3b: Liverpool beat Newcastle 4-1 at Anfield to progress to the next round of the English Premier League.
hermes3:3b: Liverpool beats Newcastle 4-1 with goals from Bramble (own goal), Neil Mellor and Milan Baros.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: At Anfield, Liverpool made a comeback to defeat Newcastle 10-man Magpies. Titus Bramble's own goal put the Reds on the trail, but they managed to take the lead with Patrick Kluivert's close-range finish after 31 minutes. However, Neil Mellor and Milan Baros scored twice more for Liverpool before half-time, and they added another goal after the hour. A red card for Lee Bowyer and a substitution foul by Dudek later in the match further weakened Newcastle's side.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Liverpool defeated Newcastle 3-1 at Anfield after coming from behind. Patrick Kluivert gave Newcastle the lead in the 32nd minute, but Titus Bramble's own goal three minutes later leveled the score. Neil Mellor put Liverpool ahead before halftime, and Milan Baros sealed the victory on the hour mark after rounding goalkeeper Shay Given. Newcastle's hopes of a comeback were dashed when Lee Bowyer was sent off for two bookable offenses. Liverpool welcomed back Luis Garcia from injury, while Newcastle had to replace Craig Bellamy with Kluivert due to a late injury. Despite some missed chances, Liverpool controlled the game, while Newcastle struggled after going down to 10 men.
stablelm2:1.6b: Liverpool came back from a goal down to beat Newcastle 5-3 in an eventful match that included a goal by Titus Bramble and own goal by Patrick Kluivert. After Newcastle took the lead with a Kluivert finish, Liverpool equalized through Steven Gerrard's corner. A third goal for Liverpool came from Milan Baros after rounding Shay Given on the hour mark. The game was marked by controversy when Bramble headed in Gerrard's corner into his own net under pressure from Sami Hyypia and Liverpool were ahead after 15 minutes with a Baros goal. Newcastle had a chance to equalize but failed to convert several opportunities. In the second half, Lee Bowyer was sent off for two bookable offenses and Luis Garcia returned for Liverpool after recovering from an injury. A final flurry of goals saw Liverpool score three more, with Baros scoring his second, and Newcastle scoring a third through Olivier Bernard's free-kick. The match ended in high drama with controversy surrounding Bramble's goal.
granite3.1-dense:2b: In a match at Anfield, Liverpool defeated injury-plagued Newcastle 3-1. Patrick Kluivert's controversial offside goal put Newcastle ahead in the 32nd minute. However, Luis Garcia and Neil Mellor scored for Liverpool, with Baros adding a third just after the hour mark. Newcastle's Lee Bowyer received a red card for a late challenge on Florent Sinama-Pongolle. Key players included Garcia, who almost scored early but shot wide, and Kewell, whose excellent pass led to Baros' second goal. Despite Bowyer's dismissal, Liverpool maintained their lead, with Mellor scoring a third for them. The match was witnessed by 43,856 spectators at Anfield.
